programme.title: Someone They Knew with Tamron Hall
programme.desc: Small-town plumber John Cataneo fixes other people's homes for a living, until death came knocking on his front door; to find out who wanted him dead, police investigate the contents of Cataneo's own home, and get the leak they need.

programme.title: Someone They Knew with Tamron Hall
programme.desc: When a well-respected psychiatrist and his adult son are killed as they sleep, police are baffled by the apparent randomness until an arrest in an unrelated crime leads them to the least likely of suspects.

programme.title: Someone They Knew with Tamron Hall
programme.desc: What begins as another sun-soaked day in Boca Raton, Fla., ends in blood-soaked violence, leaving a mother of three a quadriplegic; police find that this seemingly random act may not have been so random after all.

programme.title: Someone They Knew with Tamron Hall
programme.desc: The night begins with a birthday celebration for Susan Sutton; it ends with a nightmare when a man breaks in and opens fire, killing Susan and blinding her husband; when police track down the shooter, they can't believe who he said put him up to it.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: This case went to trial in 1996 after several delays over legal issues; that was nearly two and half years after the deaths of Dr. Ali Khalili and Merian Frederick.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: During cross-examination, the relatives of Dr. Ali Khalili and Merian Fredek claimed it wasn't a crime for Dr Jack Kevorkian to help their loved ones end their pain and suffering.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: Family members of Dr. Ali Khalili and Merian Frederick gathered around each of them, at the moment they passed away; they told jurors about their loved ones, their lives and how they ended their pain and suffering.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: The minister of one of Dr. Jack Kevorkian's patients in this case testified for the state; the families of Merian Frederick and Dr Ali Khalili said their diseases caused them daily pain and agony.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: Merian Frederick's minister read a final letter she wrote and he got choked up reading her words; the defense tried to show jurors that Dr. Kevorkian's number one goal was to end suffering.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: A doctor who specializes in blood and bone cancer told jurors about what doctor Ali Khalili experienced as he battled his illness; retired pathologist Dr. Jack Kevorkian was on trial over his death.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: An oncologist specializing in bone cancer testified about what patients go through as they fight that life-threatening disease.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: Dr. Jack Kevorkian's defense team challenged the state's medical expert; he's an oncologist who helps patients who are dealing with long-term pain management.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: Cross-examination continued the forensic psychologist who performed a full mental health evaluation of Scott Nelson.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: The judge directly addressed Scott Nelson asking him if there was any more evidence he wanted to introduce to the jury.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: Scott Nelson's defense was trying to spare his life for the capital murder of Jennifer Fulford. He took the stand in his motivation to let the jury know how maltreated he was as federal prison inmate in the past 25 years.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: Scott Nelson believed the federal prison system turned him into an animal. He told jurors that he was a homicidal manic that wanted the death penalty.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: The State's rebuttal case was underway. This would be the last attempt by them to convince the jury to recommend the death penalty for Scott Nelson in the murder of Jennifer Fulford.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: Was it a major mental illness that caused Scott Nelson to kill Jennifer Fulford or was it personalty-driven? In the State's rebuttal, a forensic psychologist, who evaluated the defendant, concluded that his actions was due to flaw in his character.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: A city worker who was in charge of scheduling snow plowing in Canton, Massachusetts took the stand.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Jurors listened to more detailed testimony from a lieutenant in the Massachusetts State Police who was responsible for a unit that does evidence searches.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Jurors saw crime scene photos during the State's case against her. Massachusetts State Police claimed when they searched the snowy area where John O'Keefe was found, they came across damaged pieces of a car taillight and John's Nike sneaker.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: The Defense had more questions for the state police Lieutenant on the stand. The goal was to poke holes in the investigation into the death of John O'Keefe.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Jurors learned of key evidence that investigators uncovered in their investigation into what happened to John O'Keefe.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Prosecutors went into details about the alleged murder weapon in this case. It wasn't a knife or gun as you see in most Court TV Trials.

programme.title: Someone They Knew with Tamron Hall
programme.desc: After leaving a work party late at night, Ramona Krotinea's body gets discovered in the trunk of her own car the next day, and police need to reconstruct who and what happened in the intervening hours.
